intro: Besleria pansamalana, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in vibrant shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are usually elliptical and glossy, providing a lush green backdrop to its colorful blooms. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
